article:
'Thomas McLaughlin' (1878 or 1879–April 1944) was an Irish nationalist
politician.

Born in Armagh, he became politically active and rose to become the chair of
Armagh Urban Council and a member of Armagh County Council. He also served as
Supreme Knight of the Knights of Saint Columbanus. "Obituary: Senator Thomas McLaughlin", [[Irish Times]], 5 April
1944 In 1928, he was the founding chairman of the National League of the
North in Armagh. "The National League in Armagh", [[Irish Times]], 16
October 1928 In 1933, he was elected to represent the Nationalist Party
in the Senate of Northern Ireland, and served until his death.
categories: Members of the Senate of Northern Ireland 1933–1937
Members of the Senate of Northern Ireland 1937–1945
